node.title: Next week's Tamworth Country Music Festival postponed due to COVID-19 concerns
node.description: Organisers of the annual Tamworth Country Music Festival have postponed next week's event due to COVID-19 uncertainty and rescheduled it for April.
node.content:
["Organisers of the Tamworth Country Music Festival have announced its 50th anniversary event will be postponed due to changes made to COVID-19 safety measures today.", "The 10-day event was set to start next week on January 14.", "It's the second year the festival has been impacted by COVID-19 after it was cancelled last year.", "The festival's manager Barry Harley said it was a hard decision to make.", "", "
People dance to the Wolfe Brothers during the bushfire appeal concert at the Tamworth Country Music Festival in 2013.(AAP: Tracey Nearmy)
", "The NSW government today announced some restrictions will be reintroduced to slow the spread of COVID-19 across the state.", "These restrictions include new risk assessments by NSW Health on major events, and a ban on signing and dancing at entertainment and hospitality venues.", "However, NSW Premier Dominic Perrottet said large events could go ahead\u00a0provided NSW did not deem the events high risk.", "NSW recorded\u00a038,625 COVID-19 cases and 11 deaths in the latest reporting period.", "", "
Troy Cassar-Daley and Adam Harvey perform at the 42nd Tamworth Country Music Festival.(AAP: Dan Himbrechts)
", "Organisers said\u00a0due to \"so much uncertainty\"\u00a0the decision had to be made to reschedule the festival to April.", "The event will also take place over a shorter period from April 18.", "\"Given the current state of COVID transmission in our communities\u00a0and the impact the changed COVID safety measures have on our venues,\" Mr Harley said.", "More to come."]
